reviews.text: Parsons Post House was wonderful!! My husband and I decided to stay here with my mom for a long weekend to show her how nice Ogunquit is. The owner Frank and his girfriend Holly were more than accomadating, especially since we choose the weekend of Hurricane Irene!! They made us feel more than comfortable providing us with hurricane kits just in case the power went out (which it never did). Holly even offered to wash our clothes after my mom and I fell in the mudd at the playhouse (it was the funniest thing you would ever see) She is also a great baker. Franks daughter was visiting and it was nice to meet her too! We only wish we could have stayed longer to meet Terry, Frank's sister. This place was clean, well decorated and very inviting!! We hope to come back again next year. What a great time!!
reviews.title: What a wonderful place to stay!

reviews.text: "Our family had a pleasant and relaxing stay at the Parsons Post House Inn. As a number of reviewers have already mentioned, the Inn is under new ownership, and has been renovated in June. The inn is located downtown, near shops and restaurants, and is within walking distance of the beach. The rooms are clean, and the beds are very comfortable. The new owners are kind, welcoming, and accommodating. One of the owners, Terry, treats her guests with delicious homemade muffins and coffee. Overall this is a great place to stay if you are looking for a cozy home away from home."
reviews.title: We enjoyed it and will be back

reviews.text: Staying at Parsons Post House was like staying with friends. The bedding and towels were almost as delicious as Terry's afternoon cookies and morning muffins!
reviews.title: We were welcomed like new friends, and left like old friends.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is perfect and the accommodations are lovely. If you want to explore the area with a comfortable place to lay your head, this is it.
reviews.title: A fabulous home away from home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Parsons Post House last week and were extremely satisfied. The owners are friendly and helpful. The baked goods are also delicious. The rooms are clean and the beds are VERY comfortable. All the towels and bedding seemed to be brand new which is always great when staying away. Thank you again Terry for a great stay and we will recommend to all of our friends!
reviews.title: a diamond in the rough!

reviews.text: My family has been staying at The Parsons Post House for over 30 yrs and it was always a great family run and owned inn. To my surprise when we arrived we found there are new owners who were wonderful from the minute we checked in to when we checked out. They have clearly updated the entire place to make it more of a beachy feel. They did a great job! When we arrived and went into our room you are welcomed with a hand written note on lovely stationary and chocolates form the Harbor candy shop. In the morning when you wake up there is always a fresh pot of coffee and homemade muffins. When you come back from a day at the beach or shopping you are greeted with a large pitcher of water with lemon wedges and sometimes some homemade cookies. All in all we of course will be back next yr and will not hesitate for a moment to recommend this Inn to our friends. Thanks for another great trip to Ogunquit!
reviews.title: We loved the new look and will be back

reviews.text: Oh almost forgot beds are sooo comfy and the egyptian cotton sheets were fabulous!!!
reviews.title: A great place. Will be back.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ron & Stacy T
reviews.title: Just like staying with family.

reviews.text: This is really a delightful place. Its location is excellent, rooms are fresh and comfortable even if not large and Terry (one of the co-owners) is just an important part of the entire package. She is smart, thoughtful and very friendly. Her morning muffins are artistically made. The entire experience during our 4 day visit was just excellent and I am looking forward to returning to the Parsons.
reviews.title: We loved the Parsons Post House Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed in room 22. It was very clean and the quality if the bedding was exceptional. View of the ocean from the sitting room on the second floor. Close to everything in Qgunquit.
reviews.title: Fabulous!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you are planning to go to Ogunquit, you should check the availability in Parsons Post House. The place is right in the center of town and close to the beach. The rooms are recently renovated and are nicely decorated (the bathrooms are on the small side though).
reviews.title: An Ogunquit gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast is basically coffe or tea and sweet treats, but, oh my God! How good they are! If fact you can be eating those muffins, cookies or cakes all day, as the porch is always stocked with them. The idea fits perfectly well both with Ogunquit and the inn.
reviews.title: Beautiful Late Summer Weekend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We happen to be there in the "Irene weekend", and the great owners made everything to help us to be prepared for it. Even Irene never got to Ogunquit, the "Hurricane basket" they left in every room the night before (games, flashlight, water, cookies) was a delicious touch.
reviews.title: Perfect!

reviews.text: My husband and I just returned from Ogunquit, ME and spent a wonderful weekend at the Parsons Post Inn. When we walked in the door I was delighted by the scent of fresh flowers which permeated the halls. The pristine white woodwork and soft pale walls whispered "beach". The location is amazing with ocean views and within walking distance of the beach and all the best restaurants in town. But what sets this haven above and beyond most is the warmth created by Frank, Holly and Terri. They are genial, helpful, full of local information and keep the treats coming both morning and afternoon.
reviews.title: Perfection

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First time but not the last! Everything was perfect. The room are very clean. Downtown Ogunquit. Everything is near!!!
reviews.title: we would stay here again...

reviews.text: This is a very nice Inn. Great location, staff and parking! This Inn is very clean recently renovated. I highly recommend it!
reviews.title: Great location, immaculate and friendly, helpful staff!!

reviews.text: Will miss the old owners Joe and his late wife Genne, but looking forward to seeing the 'new' inn soon, having heard about the renovations. Anywhere but Parson's is NOT Maine!
reviews.title: Best of Ogt

reviews.text: My daughter and I recently visited Parsons Post House Inn in Ogunquit Maine. The inn was completely renovated by the new owners and they've managed to mix old world charm with new world beauty.
reviews.title: A Beautiful Gem in Ogunquit

reviews.text: The rooms were beautifully decorated and completely redone with new paint, carpets and furniture. It was fresh, bright and very comfortable.
reviews.title: Fabulous Stay

reviews.text: There are two sitting porches with beautiful views of the ocean and area. Outside there is a lovely patio that is lit at night, a great place to unwind over a glass of wine. Next year they plan to extend the patio and add an outdoor deck to the front of the inn where we'll be able to enjoy the ocean view and breezes.
reviews.title: Little details which make a difference...
